>
[Starless Scope](/Equipment.aspx?ID=954)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Malevolence</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=48" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Malevolence](/Sources.aspx?ID=88) pg. 67</row>

**Price** 650 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Even during the time of Thassilon, when the Order of the Starless Night still existed, _starless scopes_ were uncommon. Today, this final scope might well be the last one to survive the passage of time.

 A _starless scope_ is a handheld telescope crafted of silver and fine wood. When one peers at the sky through a _starless scope_, one always views the sky as if during a clear night. A starless scope adds a +2 item bonus to [Astronomy Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) and Perception checks made to observe the skies, as it causes all celestial objects to dim when not directly observed, allowing its user to more easily observe their intended subject. It also grants a +2 item bonus to all [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) checks made to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=24).

 A starless scope also functions as a divine focus for worshipers of [Desna](/Deities.aspx?ID=5). The magic of a starless scope requires a specially prepared lens to function, and it's possible to shatter the lens if you roll poorly when activating the _starless scope_.

 Without a functional lens, a _starless scope_ doesn't function. You can replace a shattered lens with a functional lens by taking a two-action activity with the manipulate trait. If you know the formula for the starless scope, you can [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) a new lens with a DC 25 [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) (master) check. A starless scope lens is a level 9 item worth 100 gp.
